item.title: Family Coding Club
item.description:
An informal drop-in coding session for children and families. Activities include simple games, creative coding, and playful experiments with computers.

No prior experience needed. Suitable for ages 7+ with an accompanying adult.

item.title: Game jam taster, build a tiny game in two hours
item.description:
A relaxed introduction to game jams. We will form small teams (or work solo), pick a playful theme, and build a tiny game using a starter template.

No experience needed. Bring a laptop if you can.

item.title: Repair Café
item.description:
A regular Repair Café where volunteers help fix household items such as small appliances, clothing, and bikes. Bring along something broken and see if it can be repaired rather than thrown away.

No charge, donations welcome.

item.title: Pixel art for games, characters and tiles
item.description:
A practical session focused on making simple sprites, character animations, and tiles for top-down and platform games.

Beginners welcome. Suitable for ages 9+ with an accompanying adult.

item.title: Side missions and mini quests workshop
item.description:
A short, guided workshop on designing side missions and mini quests to add choice, challenge, and humour to your game.

Bring a laptop if you can. We will have a small number available to borrow.

item.title: JAMM Labs game making drop-in
item.description:
An informal drop-in for children, young people, and families to explore game making using simple templates, pixel art, and playful experiments.

Suitable for ages 8+ with an accompanying adult. No prior coding experience needed.

item.title: JAMM Labs game making drop-in

Suitable for ages 8+ with an accompanying adult. No prior coding experience needed.
